modules.description: Compares two values of type t using a custom ordering and formats them for output using the Format module. It operates on the abstract type t, which represents structured data. This is used to enforce consistent sorting and human-readable logging of internal representations.

Provides functions to select actions and update estimates in a multi-armed bandit scenario using the UCB1 algorithm. Operates on arrays of reward estimates and visit counts for each arm. Used to balance exploration and exploitation in reinforcement learning applications.

Provides functions to create and manage a multi-armed bandit, select actions using the UCB1 algorithm, update rewards, and retrieve total rewards. Operates on arrays of arms and stateful bandit structures that track arm statistics. Used to dynamically choose optimal actions in reinforcement learning scenarios, such as A/B testing or resource allocation.
